nodes.bodyText: I noticed that Go SDK uses v2beta1. But if this is indeed supported, then it's ok (and even preferred).
Yeah, I did notice that the Go implementation was using the beta. But I think the non-beta version is supported: https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com/$discovery/rest?version=v2.
I believe this should be just /tenants
After taking another look at https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com/$discovery/rest?version=v2, I'm thinking it should be "/tenants:list".
I think the query params are called pageSize and pageToken. Verify and correct if necessary.

You probably don't need this type. Just try to use the ListTenantsResponse type directly.
listUsers() API use this middle-ground type since the REST API returns a User type which needs to be mapped to ExportedUserRecord. But that requirement is not present here.
Okay, but I had to add a constructor to ListTenantsResponse so that I could construct it in the unit test.
Nit: Lets call them userMgtBaseUrl and tenantMgtBaseUrl for clarity.

You probably won't be able to parse/deserialize into this unless you also define a no-args constructor. Chances are the existing unit tests don't hit that case as of yet. But it's fine to defer adding it until we hit that case.

+import com.google.firebase.auth.Tenant;
+import java.util.List;
+
+/**
+ * JSON data binding for ListTenantsResponse messages sent by Google identity toolkit service.
+ */
+public class ListTenantsResponse {
+
+  @Key("tenants")
+  private List<Tenant> tenants;
+
+  @Key("pageToken")
+  private String pageToken;
+
+  public ListTenantsResponse(List<Tenant> tenants, String pageToken) {

nodes.bodyText:
Oh, you're right, I think we do need that (I slipped it into this PR).
No, there's not any unit tests which hit this yet. Those will come when I flesh out the other tenant methods in FirebaseUserManager.
